melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: You are the Great Giver, the Inner-knower, the Searcher of hearts.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. The feelings instilled by this Raag can be compared to those of a bride on the day of her wedding; she is happy and sad. Although she is going to her groom, who fills her with hope and joy, she is also sad to be leaving her family.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਸਭ ਮਹਿ ਰਵਿਆ ਪੂਰਨ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਸੁਆਮੀ ॥੧॥

translation.text: God, the Perfect Lord and Master, is permeating and pervading in all. ||1||

transliteration.text: sabh mah raviā pūran prabh suāmī .1.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. The feelings instilled by this Raag can be compared to those of a bride on the day of her wedding; she is happy and sad. Although she is going to her groom, who fills her with hope and joy, she is also sad to be leaving her family.

translation.text: The Name of my Beloved God is my only support.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. text: ਹਉ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਜੀਵਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਤੁਮਾਰਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: I live by hearing, continually hearing Your Name. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: hau sun sun jīvā nām tumārā .1. rahāu .

translation.text: I seek Your Sanctuary, O my Perfect True Guru.

translation.text: My mind is purified by the dust of the Saints. ||2||

translation.text: I have enshrined His Lotus Feet within my heart.

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan. ||3||

translation.text: O Nanak, chanting the Naam, the Name of the Lord, I obtain peace. ||4||5||
